intro: Nolana carnosa, commonly known as the hairy nolana, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. Its hairy leaves and stems are adaptations to reduce water loss in harsh conditions. Nolana carnosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
